title: Point Estimate for the Slope Given a Table
question_text:
Is there an association between someone eating large quantities of chocolate and being overweight? A random sample of $26$ women had their body fat percentage measured and were also were asked how much chocolate they eat a day. A computer regression analysis of the data is given below:
Dependent variable is: Body fat
$R^2 = 20.26\%$
$s= 7.89 $
VariableCoefficients.e Coefft-ratioprob
Constant23.2311.56714.320.00001
Chocolate0.05430.02172.210.037


Assuming the conditions have been satisfied and using $95\%$ confidence, which of the following represents the point estimate for the slope $t$-interval?
